info.title: 00004-GetPlanDetail-v2
info.description: The service will retrieve the customer’s mobile or broadband account plan details using accountNumber  or landlineNumber for broadband account and mobileNumber for mobile account.

get.description: The service will retrieve the customer’s mobile or broadband account plan details using accountNumber  or landlineNumber for broadband account and mobileNumber for mobile account.

parameters.name: User-Token
parameters.description:
Mobile user temporary acess token to allow api resources access.
Generated through `Customer Identity Access Management(CIAM)` API service in response to a login request.
_**Note: Required only if Digital Channel used `CIAM` as `user authentication`._

parameters.name: OTPReferenceId
parameters.description:
Generated unique identifier for the provided OTP sent to provided address such as mobile number, email, etc.
_** Note: Required only if Digital Channel used `OTP` as `API Security` for **specific use-case transaction**._

parameters.name: DeviceId
parameters.description: Customer's mobile identifier for analytics purposes, etc.

parameters.name: mobileNumber
parameters.description:
Customer's mobile number a.k.a `MSISDN` - Accepts 639xx, 09xx, 9xx format.

**Required if any of the following parameter is not provided.**:
   - accountNumber
   - landlineNumber

parameters.name: accountNumber
parameters.description: Customer's Account number, mandatory when **landlineNumber** is not provided.

parameters.name: landlineNumber
parameters.description: Customer's Landline number, mandatory when **accountNumber** is not provided.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Broadband subscriber's customer id. It's unique identifier at customer level.

200.description: The server successfully processed the request.

cxsMessageId.description: Unique identifier for any CXS transaction.

cxsRequestDateTime.description: Date in UTC. Start date time of request processing.

cxsResponseDateTime.description: Date in UTC. End date time of request processing.

cxsAccountId.description: Account Id that is generated from the CXS platform specific for each customer.

mobileNumber.description: Customer's mobile number a.k.a `MSISDN` - It can be 639xx, 09xx, 9xx format.

landlineNumber.description: Subscriber’s DUO number. It returns a value once the subscriber’s subscribe to SuperDuo Promo.

landlineNumberZone.description: Subscriber’s landline number zone. Ex. Bulacan.

billingId.description: Subscriber's plan billing period instance id.

planId.description: Unique ID for the subscriber’s plan. This will be the basis of the display name based on the Solutions CMS.

creditLimit.description: Credit Limit of the postpaid customer.

spendingLimit.description: Spending Limit of the postpaid customer.

isNonLteDataEnabled.description:
Attribute for Non-LTE Data.
If the value Is YES, this means that the subscriber is eligible to use mobile data. Otherwise, service is inactive. 
Web Data/Non-LTE is also allowed to be activated/deactivated by the user.

hasLteDataProv.description:
Attribute for web LTE provisioning. If no value indicated, service is inactive. 
LTE service is also allowed to be activated/deactivated by the user.

hasRoaming.description:
If value is YES, international roaming is permitted for subscriber’s use. 
Roaming service is also allowed to activate/deactivate by the user.

hasInternationalIncomingVoice.description:
If value is YES, an international outgoing voice is allowed for the user.
International Outgoing Voice is also allowed to be activated/deactivated by the user.

hasInternationalOutgoingVoice.description: If value is YES, an international incoming voice is allowed for the user.

hasCallerId.description: Attribute for Caller ID. If value is YES, caller ID is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasLocalIncomingVoice.description: Attribute for Local Incoming Voice. If the value is YES, a local incoming voice is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasLocalOutgoingVoice.description: Attribute for Local Outgoing Voice. If value is YES, local outgoing voice is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

canForwardCall.description: Attribute for Call Forward. If value is YES, call forward is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

canWaitCall.description: Attribute for Call Waiting. If value is YES, call waiting is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

canHoldCall.description: Attribute for Call Hold. If value is YES, call hold is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasMultipartyTeleconferencing.description: Attribute for Multi Party Conferencing. If value is YES, multiparty conferencing is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

has3gVideoCall.description: Attribute for Video Call. If value is YES, video calling (3G) is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasRingBackTone.description: Attribute for Ring Back Tone. If value is YES, ring back tone is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasIncomingSms.description: Attribute for Incoming SMS. If value is YES, incoming SMS is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasOutgoingSms.description: Attribute for Outgoing SMS. If value is YES, outgoing MMS is allowed for the user. Otherwise, service is inactive.

hasMmsLteProv.description: Attribute for MMS provisioning. If no value indicated, service is inactive.

description.description: Display name for gadget’s package in the dashboard.

planId.description: Consumable offer ID. For MLP/Legacy(Old Legacy): Offer ID of the subscriber’s plan For BEMSP: Offer ID of Ultima remaining consumable

planName.description: Type of consumable. For MLP/Legacy(Old Legacy): Offer name = Subscriber’s plan For BEMSP: Offer name = Ultima remaining consumable.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure. E refers to consumables. Refer to legends below for other units of measure and their description.

quota.description: Total Plan Consumable. Note: For MyLifestyle Plan – the value should be multiplied to 1.12 and round off to the whole number.

utilizedQuota.description: Used consumables. Note: For MyLifestyle Plan – the value should be multiplied to 1.12 and rounded off to the whole number.

remainingQuota.description: Remaining consumables. Note: For MyLifestyle Plan – the value should be multiplied to 1.12 and rounded off to the whole number.

cxsAccountId.description: Account Id that is generated from the CXS platform specific for each customer.

accountNumber.description: Account number of the customer. Available in Broadband Account

mobileNumber.description: Mobile Number of the customer. Available in Mobile Account

landlineNumber.description:
Mobile Account: This will have a value if and only when the customer subscribes to SuperDUO promo.
Broadband Account: customer’s landline number or service number.

creditLimit.description: Credit Limit of the postpaid customer.

spendingLimit.description: Spending Limit of the postpaid customer.

contractExpiryDate.description: Plan Expiry Date. Available in Broadband MyBSS account.

contractDuration.description: Plan Duration. Available in Broadband MyBSS. account

monthRemaining.description: Remaining Months of the Plan. Available in Broadband MyBSS account.

deviceInfo.description: Device Information included in plan. Available in Mobile Account.

deviceBrand.description: Device Brand included in plan. Available in Mobile Account.

bandwidth.description: Plan’s bandwidth. Available in Broadband MyBss Account.

price.description: Plan price. Available in Broadband MyBss Account.

isforVolumeBoost.description: Identifier if eligible for volume boost.

planType.description: Account’s plan type. Available in Broadband MyBss Account.

Broadband Account(MyBSS).summary: Broadband account with ethier Globe MSISDN(G) or  Innove Wireline(I) or Bayan(B) account type.

Broadband Account(ICCBS).summary: Broadband account with ICCBS(N) account type.

package.description: Ipad and iPhone 6s Rose Gold Bundle

response.remarks:
This will be the value for a broadband account.
This parameter will also be part of the request to the ff externalAPIs: - IFS-WAROP-00394-ordering-GetAssignedProducts.pdf - IFS-WAROP-00390-CustomerManagement-GetCustomerInfo.pdf
This parameter will be extracted to suffice the required parameter to IFS-WAROP-00196-crm-GetSubsAndFAForCustomer.pdf.
This parameter will be extracted to suffice the required parameter to IFS-WAROP-00394-ordering-GetAssignedProducts.pdf.

request.remarks: If not provided, this parameter will be extracted from IFS-WAROP-00390-CustomerManagement-GetCustomerInfo.pdf
If not provided, this parameter will be extracted from IFS-WAROP-00307-billing-GetAccountInfo.pdf

response.remarks: Extracted from IAPList.IAP.Pricings.APRefDetails.OfferID when PCode is "Broadband_BasePlan”
Extracted from APList.APDetails.AttrList.Attr[x].Value when PCode Name is "Spending_Limit”
Extracted from IAPList.IAP.APDetails.AttrList.Attr when PCode is "Broadband_BasePlan”
Extracted from IAPList.IAP.APDetails.AttrList.Attr when PCode is "Broadband_BasePlan”
Calculated from the months difference between Contract_Duration and date today.
Extracted from APDetails.AttrList.Attr[x].Value when PCode is "Broadband_BasePlan” and attributes Name is equal "Plan_Amount”.
Extracted from APDetails.AttrList.Attr[x].Value when PCode is "Data_Wireline” and attributes Name is "Bandwidth”

channel_auth.description:
> **Bearer authentication** (also called **token authentication**) is an [HTTP authentication scheme](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication) that involves security tokens called bearer tokens. Usually generated by the server in response to a `login request`.
The client must send this token in the Authorization header when making requests to protected resources. Channel temporary acess credential to allow api resources access.

user_token.description:
> **Bearer authentication** (also called **token authentication**) is an
[HTTP authentication
scheme](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication)
that involves security tokens called bearer tokens.  Usually generated
by the server in response to a `login request`
 The client must send this token in the Authorization header when making requests to protected resources.

Mobile user temporary acess token to allow api resources access.

basic_auth.description:
Simple authentication scheme built into the HTTP protocol. The client sends HTTP requests with the `Authorization` header that contains the word `Basic` word followed by a space and a base64-encoded string `username:password`.

For example, to authorize as `demo / p@55w0rd` the client would send: `Authorization: Basic ZGVtbzpwQDU1dzByZA==`
